meanings.definition: To move or transfer (troops or equipment) to a new position.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers will redeploy to the northern base tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to redeploy their resources to the marketing department.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up, they had to redeploy the chairs to the correct room.
meanings.sent4: She redeployed her focus from the project to her upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The ants quickly redeployed their food to a safer location.

meanings.definition: To assign to a new position or task.
meanings.sent1: The manager will redeploy the staff to different departments for the event.
meanings.sent2: It's time to redeploy our efforts towards a more sustainable approach.
meanings.sent3: He had to redeploy his cat from the keyboard to finish typing the report.
meanings.sent4: She redeployed her creativity to come up with a new solution.
meanings.sent5: The teacher decided to redeploy the students to new seating arrangements.

meanings.sent1: They will redeploy the security measures after the event.
meanings.sent2: The software developer had to redeploy the latest update due to a bug.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to redeploy the ingredients after realizing a mistake.
meanings.sent4: He redeployed the strategy for the project to ensure success.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to redeploy their efforts for a fresh start.
